object.name: Messier 95

image.title: This photo from Messier 95 was taken up by an amateur astronomer from Austria.
In the Leo I group, Messier 95 is outshone by its brother Messier 96.
Messier 95, 24 inch telescope on Mt. Lemmon, AZ. Courtesy of Joseph D. Schulman

object.information: Messier 95 (also known as M95 or NGC 3351) is a barred spiral galaxy about 38 million light-years away in the constellation Leo. It was discovered by Pierre Méchain in 1781, and catalogued by Charles Messier four days later. On 16 March 2012, a supernova was discovered in M95. The center of the galaxy contains a ring-shaped circumnuclear star-forming region with a diameter of approximately 2000 ly (600 pc). M95 is one of several galaxies within the M96 Group, a group of galaxies in the constellation Leo. The group also includes the Messier objects M96 and M105. A Type II supernova, designated as SN 2012aw, was discovered in M95 on 16 March 2012.

link.title: Get more info about Messier 95 in Wikipedia
